metadata.title: CVE-2020-26160 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: jwt-go before 4.0.0-preview1 allows attackers to bypass intended access restrictions in situations with []string{} for m["aud"] (which is allowed by the specification). Because the type assertion fails, "" is the value of aud. This is a security problem if the JWT token is presented to a service that lacks its own audience check.

notes.note: mdeslaur> as of 2020-10-02, the proposed patches have not been accepted into the upstream tree.  juju-core doesn't use jwt-go in a way that exposes the vulnerability

criterions.comment: golang-github-coreos-discovery-etcd-io package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
telegraf package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
